title: Minitab Output
question_text: The data below shows mini tab output for the relationship between the number of cricket chirps per minute and temperature. The regression equation for this relationship is: $Temp = 44+0.993x$ Predictor Coef St Dev t Ratio P Constant 44.013 1.827 24.09 0 Number 0.99340 0.06523 15.23 0 S=1.536 R-Sq = 95.9% R-sq(adj) = 95.5% -- -- Which of the following statements is true concerning the least squares regression line?

choices.text: One would predict the temperature to be about 0.993 0.993 degrees if there are no chirps.
One would expect the temperature to be about 0.993 0.993 degrees higher for every extra chirp per minute heard.
The least squares regression line has a slope of about 44 44 degrees.
The least squares regression line will have a negative slope.
One would expect about 44 44 chirps per minute if it were 100 100 degrees outside.
